Description: Arsenical copper axe-head: elongated and with rounded ends to the cutting edge. The butt is straight. It has been cleaned of corrosion product and is in very good condition, save for some minute surface faults. The impression of the original haft is preserved along the butt. There is a small burr caused by hammering beneath one of the lugs. The cutting edge is quite sharp but there are no obvious signs of wear.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (110)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
